HandGroups = 
{
	1 => %w{AA KK QQ JJ AKs},
	2 => %w{TT AQs AJs KQs AKo},
	3 => %w{99 ATs KJs QJs TJs AQo},
	4 => %w{88 KTs QTs J9s T9s 98s AJo KQo},

- (Object) add_random_card_not_in(cards, used)

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 377

def add_random_card_not_in(cards, used)
	loop do
		card = random_card
		unless used.any_set(card)
			cards << card
			used << card
			break
		end
	end
end

- (Integer) compare_hands(p1, p2, board)

Compares two hands by evaluating them against the current board

Parameters:

    The first player's pocket cards

  • p2 (String) —

    The second player's pocket cards

  • board (String) —

    The board cards

Returns:

  • (Integer) —

    1 if p1 wins, -1 if p2 wins, 0 of they are equal



159

161
162
163
164
165
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 159

def compare_hands(p1,p2,board)
	p1score = PokerEvalAPI.Eval_Str_N(p1 + board)
	p2score = PokerEvalAPI.Eval_Str_N(p2 + board)
	return -1 if p1score < p2score
	return 0 if p1score == p2score
	return 1 if p1score > p2score
end

- (Object) effective_hand_strength(pocket, board, hs = nil, use_npot = false)

Returns the EHS of the current hand

Parameters:

    The player's pocket cards

  • board (String) —

    The board cards

  • hs (Integer) (defaults to: nil) —

    (optional) The hand strength to use in the calculation. If not specified, will be calculated

  • use_npot (Boolean) (defaults to: false) —

    (optional, default false) Whether or not to return the negative potential

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 173

def effective_hand_strength(pocket, board, hs = nil, use_npot = false)
	hs ||= hand_strength(pocket, board)
	return 0 if pocket.empty? || board.empty?
	(ppot, npot) = hand_potential(pocket, board)
	npot = 0 unless use_npot
	ehs = hs * (1 - npot) + (1 - hs) * ppot
	return {
		ehs: ehs,
		ppot: ppot,
		npot: npot
	}
end

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 297

def eval_outs(pocket, board)
	psize = pocket.length / 2
	bsize = board.length / 2

	stages = {
		'3' => "Flop",
		'4' => "Turn",
		'5' => "River"
	}

	r_stages = {}

	# 3..5 = for flop, turn, river
	(3..5).each do |tot|
		next if tot <= bsize
		stage = stages[tot.to_s]

		results = []

		# simple callback to fetch results for each iteration
		cb = Proc.new do |i,cards|
			results.push(i)
		end

		# run the eval
		PokerEvalAPI.evalOuts(pocket, psize, board, bsize, tot, cb)

		stats = []

		# collect stats for each type of hand
		results.each do |e|
			stats[e] = (stats[e] || 0) + 1
		end

		# get sum
		total = stats.inject(0) {|sum, n| sum += (n || 0)}

		stats_name = {}

		# get percentages
		(0..8).each do |i|
			pct = (((stats[i] || 0) / total.to_f) * 100)
			stats_name[HandTypes[i]] = pct
		end
		
		# set percentages for this stage
		r_stages[stage] = stats_name
	end

	# return percentages
	return r_stages
end

- (Float) get_equity(options = {})

Does a montecarlo simulation to estimate the strength of a given hand

    a customizable set of options

    The player's hole cards

  • :board (String) —

    The board cards

  • :iterations (Integer) —

    The number of montecarlo simulations

  • :num_opponents (Integer) —

    The number of opponent hands to simulate

Returns:

  • (Float) —

    The percentage of times the player's hand wins

def get_equity(options = {})
	defaults = {
		pocket: '',
		board: '',
		iterations: 500,
		num_opponents: 1
	}

	options = defaults.merge(options)

	pocket = options[:pocket]
	board = options[:board]
	num_opponents = options[:num_opponents]
	num_iter = options[:iterations]

	pcards = get_cards(pocket)
	bcards = get_cards(board)
	dead = new_cards
	dead << pcards
	dead << bcards
	player_sizes = [2] * num_opponents
	player_sizes << 5 - bcards.count

	ahead = tied = behind = 0

	montecarlo_sets(player_sizes, dead, num_iter) do |sets|
		board = sets.pop
		ours = dead.clone
		ours << board
		ourscore = ours.eval(7)
		
		oppscores = sets.map {|cards| cards << board; cards.eval(7)}
		score = oppscores.max
		ahead += 1 if ourscore > score
		tied += 1 if ourscore == score
		behind += 1 if ourscore < score
	end

	equity = (ahead+tied/2.0) / (ahead+tied+behind)
	return equity
end

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 368

def get_random_hand_not_in_str(str)
	used = get_cards(str)
	cards = new_cards
	add_random_card_not_in(cards, used)
	add_random_card_not_in(cards, used)
	return cards.to_s
end

end

- (Array) hand_potential(pocket, board, maxcards = 6)

Returns the hand potential (positive and negative) of the current hand By default will only do a one-card lookahead

Parameters:

  • pocket (String) —

    The player's hole cards

  • board (String) —

    The board cards

  • maxcards (Integer) (defaults to: 6) —

    The maximum number of cards to score (7 is 2-card lookahead, 6 is 1-card)

Returns:

  • (Array) 


288

295
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 288

def hand_potential(pocket, board, maxcards = 6)
	if ((board.length / 2) == 5)
		return [0,0]
	end
	ppot = FFI::MemoryPointer.new(:pointer, 1);
	PokerEvalAPI.handPotential(pocket, board, ppot, maxcards)
	return ppot.read_pointer.read_string.split("|").map{|e| e.to_f}
end

- (Object) hand_strength(pocket, board, opponents = 1, weight_table = {})

Returns the hand strength using Ruby

Parameters:

  • pocket (String) —

    The player's pocket cards

  • board (String) —

    The board cards

  • opponents (Integer) (defaults to: 1) —

    (default: 1) The number of opponents

  • weight_table (Hash) (defaults to: {}) —

    (default: {}) A weight table to adjust the score given to each pair of opponent's cards.

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 212

def hand_strength(pocket, board, opponents = 1, weight_table = {})
	ahead = tied = behind = 0
	score = PokerEvalAPI.Eval_Str_N(pocket + board)
	weighted_proc = Proc.new do |i, cards|
		w = get_weight_from_table(cards, weight_table)
		ahead += w if score > i
		tied += w if score == i
		behind += w if score < i
	end
	normal_proc =  Proc.new do |i, cards|
		ahead += 1 if score > i
		tied += 1 if score == i
		behind += 1 if score < i
	end
	cb = weight_table.empty? ? normal_proc : weighted_proc
	PokerEvalAPI.scoreTwoCards(pocket, board, cb)
	handstrength = (ahead+tied/2.0) / (ahead+tied+behind)
	return handstrength ** opponents
end

- (Integer) hand_to_sklansky_group(hand_str)

Calculates the 'Sklansky group' of 2 hole cards, where 1 is the best and 8 is the worst.

Parameters:

  • hand_str (String) —

    The hole cards

Returns:

  • (Integer) —

    The Sklansky group



469
470
471
472
473
474
475
476
477
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 469

def hand_to_sklansky_group(hand_str)
	abbr = str_to_abbr(hand_str)
	HandGroups.each do |group, hands|
		if hands.include?(abbr)
			return group
		end
	end
	return 8
end

def mask_to_str(cards_n)
	cm = PokerEvalAPI::CardMask.new
	cm[:cards_n] = cards_n
	return cm.to_s
end

- (Object) montecarlo(dead, num_cards, num_iter)

Performs a montecarlo simulation, yielding the generated cards

364
365
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 356

def montecarlo(dead, num_cards, num_iter)
	num_iter.times do
		cards = new_cards
		used = dead.clone
		num_cards.times do
			add_random_card_not_in(cards, used)
		end
		yield cards
	end
end

- (Object) montecarlo_sets(set_sizes, dead, num_iter)

Deals random cards in the given sizes of sets, up to the requested number of iterations This can be used for Montecarlo simulations.

Parameters:

  • set_sizes (Array) —

    The number of cards in each set

  • dead (PokerEvalAPI::CardMask) —

    Cards to exclude from the selection

  • num_iter (Integer) —

    The number of iterations



394

402
403
404
405
406
407
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 394

def montecarlo_sets(set_sizes, dead, num_iter)
	num_iter.times do
		used = dead.clone
		sets = []
		set_sizes.each do |size|
			set_cards = new_cards
			size.times do
				add_random_card_not_in(set_cards, used)
			end
			sets << set_cards
		end
		yield sets
	end
end

- (String) str_to_abbr(str)

Returns a short abbreviation of the current hand, eg. AA, AKs or AKo

  • (String) —

    The abbreviation for the given hand

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 440

def str_to_abbr(str)
	chars = str.split(//)
	ranks = [chars[0], chars[2]].sort {|b,a| (Ranks[a.to_sym] || a.to_i) <=> (Ranks[b.to_sym] || b.to_i)}
	suited = ''
	if chars[1] == chars[3] 
		suited = 's'
	elsif chars[0] != chars[2]
		suited = 'o'
	end
	return ranks.join('') + suited
end

def str_to_hs(pocket, board)
	return hs(get_cards(pocket), get_cards(board))
end

def type_hand(hand, board)
	type = PokerEvalAPI.Eval_Str_Type(hand + board)
	return HandTypes[type]
end
